recommended_treatment: Adjuvant external beam radiation therapy with or without vaginal brachytherapy
description: Radical hysterectomy specimen shows FIGO grade 1 endometrioid adenocarcinoma arising from the lower uterine segment with 100% myometrial invasion, cervical stromal involvement, extensive lymphovascular invasion, and negative lymph nodes and margins.
patient_notes: The report shows a well-differentiated uterine cancer that invaded through the uterine muscle into the cervix but did not spread to lymph nodes. You have already had surgery and the next step is radiation therapy to the pelvis with possible internal radiation (brachytherapy). This treatment aims to destroy any remaining cancer cells and reduce the chance of recurrence. We will support you through each part of your treatment.

verification.assessment: All fields are accurate; staging is correctly identified as FIGO Stage II based on cervical stromal invasion (pT2), negative nodes (N0), and absence of metastasis (M0).
